trans-unit.source: View device telemetry in the dashboard
trans-unit.target: View device telemetry in the dashboard

trans-unit.source: The dashboard in the remote monitoring solution enables you to view the telemetry that your devices send to IoT Hub.
trans-unit.target: The dashboard in the remote monitoring solution enables you to view the telemetry that your devices send to IoT Hub.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, return to the remote monitoring solution dashboard, click **Devices** in the left-hand panel to navigate to the **Devices list**.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, return to the remote monitoring solution dashboard, click **Devices** in the left-hand panel to navigate to the **Devices list**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Devices list**, you should see that the status of your device is now **Running**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Devices list**, you should see that the status of your device is now **Running**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Dashboard** to return to the dashboard, select your device in the **Device to View** drop-down to view its telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Click **Dashboard** to return to the dashboard, select your device in the **Device to View** drop-down to view its telemetry.

trans-unit.source: The telemetry from the sample application is 50 units for internal temperature, 55 units for external temperature, and 50 units for humidity.
trans-unit.target: The telemetry from the sample application is 50 units for internal temperature, 55 units for external temperature, and 50 units for humidity.

trans-unit.source: Note that by default the dashboard displays only temperature and humidity values.
trans-unit.target: Note that by default the dashboard displays only temperature and humidity values.

trans-unit.source: Send a command to your device
trans-unit.target: Send a command to your device

trans-unit.source: The dashboard in the remote monitoring solution enables you to request IoT Hub to send commands to your devices.
trans-unit.target: The dashboard in the remote monitoring solution enables you to request IoT Hub to send commands to your devices.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the remote monitoring solution you can send a command to set the internal temperature of a device.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the remote monitoring solution you can send a command to set the internal temperature of a device.

trans-unit.source: In the remote monitoring solution dashboard, click **Devices** in the left-hand panel to navigate to the **Devices list**.
trans-unit.target: In the remote monitoring solution dashboard, click **Devices** in the left-hand panel to navigate to the **Devices list**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Device ID** for your device in the **Devices list**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Device ID** for your device in the **Devices list**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Device details** panel, click **Commands**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Device details** panel, click **Commands**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Command** drop-down, select **SetTemperature**, and then in **Temperature** enter a new temperature value.
trans-unit.target: In the **Command** drop-down, select **SetTemperature**, and then in **Temperature** enter a new temperature value.

trans-unit.source: Click **Send command** to send the command to the device.
trans-unit.target: Click **Send command** to send the command to the device.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The command history initially shows the command status as **Pending**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The command history initially shows the command status as **Pending**.

trans-unit.source: When the device acknowledges the command, the status changes to **Success**.
trans-unit.target: When the device acknowledges the command, the status changes to **Success**.

trans-unit.source: On the dashboard, verify that the device is now sending 75 as the new temperature value.
trans-unit.target: On the dashboard, verify that the device is now sending 75 as the new temperature value.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: The article [Customizing preconfigured solutions][lnk-customize] describes some ways you can extend this sample.
trans-unit.target: The article [Customizing preconfigured solutions][lnk-customize] describes some ways you can extend this sample.

trans-unit.source: Possible extensions include using real sensors and implementing additional commands.
trans-unit.target: Possible extensions include using real sensors and implementing additional commands.
